  • CLI

CLI

flow

CLI for creating & managing flow networks

flow [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...

Options

--debug

Debug switch

-d, --db <db>

Database URI

--backend <backend>

Task queue backend

--broker <broker>

Message broker URI

-a, --api <api>

Message broker API URI

-u, --user <user>

Message broker API user

-p, --password <password>

Message broker API password

-i, --ini <ini>

flow .ini configuration file

-c, --config

Configure pyfi

add

Add an object to the database

flow add [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...

Options

--id <id>

ID of object being added

agent

Add agent object to the database

flow add agent [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>

Required

-nd, --node <node>

Required

argument

Add argument to plug

flow add argument [OPTIONS]

Options

-p, --plug <plug>

Required Name of plug

-t, --task <task>

Required Name of task

-a, --argument <argument>

Required Name of argument

deployment

Add a deployment

flow add deployment [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>

Required Name of a processor

-d, --deploy <deploy>

Required Name of this deployment

-h, --hostname <hostname>

Target server hostname

-c, --cpus <cpus>

Number of CPUs

log

Add a log to the database

flow add log [OPTIONS]

Options

-i, --id <id>

id of object

-s, --source <source>

Source name

-t, --text <text>

Text of log

network

Create a named network

flow add network [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>

Required

node

Add node object to the database

flow add node [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>

Required

-h, --hostname <hostname>

Hostname of the node

plug

Add plug to a processor

flow add plug [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>

Required

-q, --queue <queue>

Required Queue name

-s, --source <source>

Required Source socket name

-t, --target <target>

Required Target socket name

privilege

Add privilege to the database

flow add privilege [OPTIONS]

Options

-u, --user <user>

Required

-n, --name <name>

Required

-r, --role <role>

processor

Add processor to the database

flow add processor [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>

Required Name of this processor

-m, --module <module>

Required Python module (e.g. some.module.path

-h, --hostname <hostname>

Target server hostname

-w, --workers <workers>

Number of worker tasks

-r, --retries <retries>

Number of retries to invoke this processor

-g, --gitrepo <gitrepo>

Required Git repo URI

-c, --commit <commit>

Git commit id for processor code

-rs, --requested_status <requested_status>

The requested status for this processor

-b, --beat

Enable the beat scheduler

-br, --branch <branch>

Git branch to be used for checkouts

-p, --password <password>

Password to access this processor

-rq, --requirements <requirements>

requirements.txt file

-e, --endpoint <endpoint>

API endpoint path

-a, --api <api>

Has an API endpoint

-cs, --cpus <cpus>

Number of CPUs for default deployment

-d, --deploy

Enable the beat scheduler

-mp, --modulepath <modulepath>

Relative repo path to python module file

queue

Add queue object to the database

flow add queue [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>

Required

-t, --type <type>

Required

Default

direct

Options

topic | direct | fanout

role

Add role object to the database

flow add role [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>

Required

scheduler

Add scheduler object to the database

flow add scheduler [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>

Required

-s, --strategy <strategy>
Options

BALANCED | EFFICIENT

socket

Add socket to a processor

flow add socket [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>

Required

-q, --queue <queue>

Required Queue name

-i, --interval <interval>

Interval in seconds this socket is triggered

-pn, --procname <procname>

Required Processor name

-t, --task <task>

Required Task name

task

Add task to the database

flow add task [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>

Required Name of this task

-m, --module <module>

Required Python module (e.g. some.module.path

-c, --code

Code flag. reads from stdin.

-r, --repo <repo>

Git repo containing packages

user

Add user object to the database

flow add user [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>

Required

-e, --email <email>

Required

-p, --password <password>

Required

agent

Commands for remote agent management

flow agent [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...

kill

Kill an agent

flow agent kill [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>

Required Name of agent

start

Start an agent

flow agent start [OPTIONS]

Options

-p, --port <port>

Healthcheck port

--clean

Remove work directories before launch

-b, --backend <backend>

Message backend URI

-r, --broker <broker>

Message broker URI

-n, --name <name>

Hostname for this agent to use

-c, --config <config>

Config module.object import (e.g. path.to.module.MyConfigClass

-q, --queues

Run the queue monitor only

-u, --user <user>

Run the worker as user

-po, --pool <pool>

Process pool for message dispatches

-cp, --cpus <cpus>

Number of CPUs

-s, --size <size>

Maximum number of messages on worker internal queue

-h, --host <host>

Remote hostname to start the agent via ssh

-wp, --workerport <workerport>

Healthcheck port for worker

stop

Stop an agent

flow agent stop [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>

Required Name of agent

api

API server admin

flow api [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...

start

Run pyfi API server

flow api start [OPTIONS]

Options

-ip <ip>

IP bind address

-p, --port <port>

Listen port

compose

Manage declarative infrastructure files

flow compose [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...

build

Build infrastructure from a yaml file

flow compose build [OPTIONS] [NODES]...

Options

-f, --file <file>
-d, --deploy

Deploy the network

Arguments

NODES

Optional argument(s)

kill

Kill a running infrastructure

flow compose kill [OPTIONS] FILENAME

Arguments

FILENAME

Required argument

db

Database operations

flow db [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...

drop

Drop all database tables

flow db drop [OPTIONS]

Options

-y, --yes

Yes to rebuild without prompting

init

Initialize database tables

flow db init [OPTIONS]

Options

-r, --rls

Row level security

json

Dump the database to JSON

flow db json [OPTIONS]

migrate

Perform database migration/upgrade

flow db migrate [OPTIONS]

Options

-d, --directory <directory>

Directory of migration pyfi agent

rebuild

Drop and rebuild database tables

flow db rebuild [OPTIONS]

Options

-y, --yes

Yes to rebuild now

delete

Delete an object from the database

flow delete [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...

agent

Delete an agent from the database

flow delete agent [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>

Required Name of agent being deleted

calls

Delete all the call records

flow delete calls [OPTIONS]

deployment

Delete a deployment

flow delete deployment [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>

Name of deployment

network

Delete a network

flow delete network [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>

Name of network

plug

Delete a plug from the database

flow delete plug [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>

Required Name of plug being deleted

processor

Delete a processor from the database

flow delete processor [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>

Required Name of processor being deleted

socket

Delete a socket from the database

flow delete socket [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>

Required Name of socket being deleted

task

Delete a task from the database

flow delete task [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>

Required Name of task being deleted

user

Delete a user object from the database

flow delete user [OPTIONS]

Options

--id <id>

Required ID of user being deleted

listen

Listen to a processor output

flow listen [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>

Required Name of processor

-c, --channel <channel>

Required Listen channel (e.g. task, log, etc)

-a, --adaptor <adaptor>

Adaptor class function (e.g. my.module.class.function)

login

Log into flow CLI

flow login [OPTIONS]

Options

-d, --database

Database login only

logout

Logout current user

flow logout [OPTIONS]

ls

List database objects and their relations

flow ls [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...

agent

List an agent

flow ls agent [OPTIONS]

agents

List agents

flow ls agents [OPTIONS]

call

List a call

flow ls call [OPTIONS]

Options

--id <id>

ID of call

-n, --name <name>

Name of call

-r, --result

Show result of call

-t, --tree

Show forward call tree

-g, --graph

Show complete call graph

-f, --flow

Show all calls in a workflow

calls

List calls

flow ls calls [OPTIONS]

Options

-p, --page <page>
-r, --rows <rows>
-u, --unfinished
-a, --ascend
-i, --id
-t, --tracking
-tk, --task

cpus

List network cpus

flow ls cpus [OPTIONS]

deployments

List deployments

flow ls deployments [OPTIONS]

job

List a job

flow ls job [OPTIONS]

jobs

List scheduled jobs

flow ls jobs [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>

Name of processor

-p, --page <page>
-r, --rows <rows>
-a, --ascend

network

List the flow network

flow ls network [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>

Required Name of network

-h, --horizontal

Horizontal tree mode

-v, --vertical

Vertical tree mode

networks

List current networks

flow ls networks [OPTIONS]

node

List a node

flow ls node [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>

Required Name of node

-t, --tree

Display object tree

-h, --horizontal

Vertical tree mode

nodes

List nodes

flow ls nodes [OPTIONS]

passwords

List hashed passwords

flow ls passwords [OPTIONS]

plug

List a plug

flow ls plug [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>

Required Name of processor

plugs

List plugs

flow ls plugs [OPTIONS]

processor

List a processor

flow ls processor [OPTIONS]

Options

--id <id>

ID of call

-n, --name <name>

Name of call

-g, --graph

Show complete call graph

processors

List processors

flow ls processors [OPTIONS]

Options

-g, --gitrepo
-c, --commit
-m, --module
-o, --owner

queue

List a queue

flow ls queue [OPTIONS]

Options

--id <id>

ID of call

-n, --name <name>

Name of queue

-t, --task <task>

Name of task

queues

List queues

flow ls queues [OPTIONS]

role

flow ls role [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>

Required

-p, --page <page>

-a, --ascend

scheduler

flow ls scheduler [OPTIONS]

schedulers

flow ls schedulers [OPTIONS]

socket

flow ls socket [OPTIONS]

Options

--id <id>

ID of call

-n, --name <name>

Name of call

-g, --graph

Show complete call graph

sockets

List sockets

flow ls sockets [OPTIONS]

stats

List object stats

flow ls stats [OPTIONS]

task

List a task

flow ls task [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>

Required Name of task

-s, --source

Source of task function

-c, --code

Code override of task

-p, --plugs

Show plugs

-so, --sockets

Show sockets

tasks

List tasks

flow ls tasks [OPTIONS]

Options

-g, --gitrepo

user

List a user

flow ls user [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>

Required

users

List users

flow ls users [OPTIONS]

work

worker

flow ls worker [OPTIONS]

workers

List workers

flow ls workers [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name

List worker names

network

Network operations

flow network [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...

add

Add node to a network

flow network add [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>

Name of network

-nd, --node <node>

Name of node to add

node

Node management operations

flow node [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...

clone

Clone the current virtual environment to the node host –to

flow node clone [OPTIONS]

Options

-t, --to <to>

Required

proc

Run or manage processors

flow proc [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...

Options

--id <id>

ID of processor

pause

Pause a processor

flow proc pause [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>

remove

Remove a processor

flow proc remove [OPTIONS]

restart

Start a processor

flow proc restart [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>

resume

Pause a processor

flow proc resume [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>

start

Start a processor

flow proc start [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>

stop

Stop a processor

flow proc stop [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>

scheduler

Scheduler management commands

flow scheduler [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...

Options

--id <id>

ID of scheduler

-n, --name <name>

Name of scheduler

add

Add a node to a scheduler

flow scheduler add [OPTIONS]

Options

-nd, --node <node>

Name of node to add

remove

Remove node from scheduler

flow scheduler remove [OPTIONS]

Options

-nd, --node <node>

Name of node to remove

start

Start the default scheduler

flow scheduler start [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>

Required

-i, --interval <interval>
-nd, --nodeployments
-c, --class <clazz>

task

Pyfi task management

flow task [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...

code

Print the task source code

flow task code [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>

Required Name of task

run

Run a task

flow task run [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>

Name of task to run

-f, --format <format>

Type of return data (json, pickle, raw)

-s, --socket <socket>

Name of socket associated with the task to run

-d, --data <data>

Python evaluated string to pass to the socket’s task

-nd, --nodata

Set this flag if no data is being passed in.

-a, --argument <argument>

Name of argument to pass

-sy, --synchronized

Execute full data flow from this task, wait for result.

show

Show details for a task

flow task show [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>

Required Name of task to run

-g, --gitrepo

update

Update a database object

flow update [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...

plug

Update or move a processor plug

flow update plug [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>

Required

-q, --queue <queue>

Required Queue name

-pi, --procid <procid>

Processor id

-pn, --procname <procname>

Processor name

processor

Update a processor in the database

flow update processor [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>
-m, --module <module>
-h, --hostname <hostname>

Target server hostname

-w, --workers <workers>

Number of worker tasks

-g, --gitrepo <gitrepo>

Git repo URI

-c, --commit <commit>

Git commit id for processor code

-b, --beat
-r, --requested_status <requested_status>
-br, --branch <branch>
-p, --password <password>
-co, --container
-mp, --modulepath <modulepath>

socket

Update a socket in the database

flow update socket [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>

Required

-q, --queue <queue>

Queue name

-i, --interval <interval>
-pi, --procid <procid>

Processor id

-pn, --procname <procname>

Processor name

-t, --task <task>

Task name

task

Update task in the database

flow update task [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>

Required

-m, --module
-c, --code

Code flag. reads from stdin.

user

User commands

flow user [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...

add

Add roles and privileges to a user

flow user add [OPTIONS]

Options

-u, --user <user>

Required

-r, --role <role>
-p, --privilege <privilege>

remove

Remove roles and privileges from a user

flow user remove [OPTIONS]

Options

-u, --user <user>

Required

-r, --role <role>
-p, --privilege <privilege>

web

Web server admin

flow web [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...

start

Run pyfi test web server

flow web start [OPTIONS]

Options

-p, --port <port>

Listen port

whoami

Database login user

flow whoami [OPTIONS]

worker

Run pyfi worker

flow worker [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...

kill

Kill a pyfi worker

flow worker kill [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>

Required Name of worker

start

Start a pyfi worker

flow worker start [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>

Required Name of worker

-a, --agent <agent>

Required Name of agent

-h, --hostname <hostname>

Required Hostname to use

-p, --pool <pool>

Size of worker pool

-s, --skip-venv

Skip building the virtual environment

-q, --queue <queue>

Maximum number of messages on worker internal queue
